metadata.title: CVE-2020-0543 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Incomplete cleanup from specific special register read operations in someIntel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.14
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.14
libxenevtchn1 - 4.14
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.14
libxengnttab1 - 4.14
libxenmisc4.11 - 4.14
libxenstore3.0 - 4.14
libxentoolcore1 - 4.14
libxentoollog1 - 4.14
xen-hypervisor-4.11-amd64 - 4.14
xen-hypervisor-4.11-arm64 - 4.14
xen-hypervisor-4.11-armhf - 4.14
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.14
xen-system-amd64 - 4.14
xen-system-arm64 - 4.14
xen-system-armhf - 4.14
xen-utils-4.11 - 4.14
xen-utils-common - 4.14
xenstore-utils - 4.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.14').
